instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Boot Loop
threads.message:
Hi !

This board come from a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, not turning on, that has been lightly liquid damaged, but at the wrong spot. Indeed, oxydation was on right side of <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> (pin 1 to 5), and also on <CAPACITOR>C7433</CAPACITOR>, nothing too big here. The rest of the board was in good condition.

I replaced <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C7433</CAPACITOR>, then the Mac turned on, Apple logo for few sec, progess bar appeared and then froze for 10 sec. The MacBook boot loop, again and again.

I replaced <CHIP>U7430</CHIP>, I though it could have been also damaged, no change. Then I cleaned ME Region, no change. I replaced BIOS with know working one, no change, I put the original one back.

Last step, I put the board in ultrasonic cleaner, it could have crap under CPU, still same behavior.

What could cause a freeze while loading OS, and what could I check next ?

Thank you for your advises.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Boot Loop
threads.message:
Any error pops up starting in diagnostic mode?
Also test if boots in safe mode.

Did you try Internet Recovery?
If there is important data, check if can save it in Target Disk mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Boot Loop
threads.message:
I've tried none of these so far.

So, diag mode freeze after 1 minute, can't finish it, as the internet recovery. Boot in safe mode has same result as normal boot, crash immediately at the beginning of the loading. Finally, Target Mode does not work, I have 2 logos on target screen (power and USB), but nothing on host. I tried with 2 different official thunderbolt cables.

When the Mac is waiting for internet network selection in recovery mode, it is able so stay on w/o any problem, but as soon as I enter password and it start downloading OS recovery it freeze and shut off.

One more thing I did not mention before, I've tried the board in an other casing to rule out the possibility of bad screen, battery, trackpad or keyboard, same result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Boot Loop
threads.message:
Try full known good (clean ME) BIOS.
Corruption into pure BIOS area, can't be solved cleaning ME Region.

Also check if you can install Windows.
If yes, check if crashes after installing GPU driver.
